sentence.Network_en: Her joy at the birth of a son beggared dlscription.
sentence.Network_cn: 她生了一个儿子,那种欣喜的心情是无法形容的.

sentence.Network_en: He was beggared by spending so much on drinking.
sentence.Network_cn: 他没节制地花钱买酒,因而沦为乞丐.

sentence.Network_en: The spectacle was so dazzlingly beautiful that it beggared description.
sentence.Network_cn: 这景象美极了,简直无法形容.

entry.def: A beggar is someone who lives by asking people for money or food.

entry.tran: 使极度贫穷；使一贫如洗
entry.def: If something beggars a person, country, or organization, it makes them very poor.

example.ex: He warned that lifting copyright restrictions could beggar the industry.
example.tran: 他警告说解除版权限制会使这个行业一贫如洗。

entry.tran: 无法，难以（相信、描述、形容等）
entry.def: If something beggars belief, it is impossible to believe it. If something beggars description, it is impossible to describe it.

example.tran: 统计数据让人难以置信。
他的胆量无法用语言来形容。

auth_sentence.content: His creations defied nature and beggared belief.
auth_sentence.res_content: His creations defied nature and beggared belief.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: His creations defied nature and beggared belief.

auth_sentence.content: He also beggared nine weak-minded relatives.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He also beggared nine weak-minded relatives.

auth_sentence.content: The Cause which had taken their friends, lovers, husbands and beggared their families.
